item.title: [Delta] how to make quests on Destiny Pk [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

neroxx:

it looks great, but u know when u start a quest, on the quest tab it says: example: “Halloween event” with red colour, and when you are in the middle of the quest, it change colour to yellow, and when you are done with it it changes colour to green and when you click it it says that you have cpmpleted the quest. ??

Yeah, then u can’t use what I just showed.
U will have to use the qs then
In most newer sources it’s automatically in there
search for quest
and u will see something like q1 q2
U can add the interfaces in there.

So example

if q1 == 0 open interface (with text) if q1 == 1 open interface (with other text) if q1 == 2 open interface (quest finished)

for the npc’s u talk to u just add the qs to them
so

if npcid == # { if q == 0 talk("fezg",125); } if npc == * { q == 1;
//so if u talked to this npc (*) q == 0 changes to q == 1
this makes that when the player clicks in the tab the text will be on q == 1 from the interfaces u added.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] how to make quests on Destiny Pk [Delta]

item.title: [Delta] how to make quests on Destiny Pk [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Easiest way

[code]if npcid == #
talk(“get me stuff”, npcid);

if npcif == @
talk("bring stuff to #)
addItem(stuffid, amount);

if (npcid == # && playerhasitem (stiffid, amount) {
talk(“thank you”, npcid);
deleteItem(stuffId, amount);
} else {
sM(“I should get him the stuff”);[/code]

Something like this,
It’s better to work with q1 ect… though

item.title: [Delta] how to make quests on Destiny Pk [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @lolboy396 lolboy396
item.description:
@lolboy396 wrote:

Not hard Just Do
if (command.startsWith(“COMMAND NAME”)) {
sM(“MESSAGE”);
}
}

If u get and error change “sM” to “sendMessage” (without “”)
